Problem:
We consider the behavior of a complex function \\( z(t) = x(t) + i y(t) \\), evolving under a linear transformation described by the matrix \\( A \\) applied on the vector representation \\( (x, y) \\). An integral transformation \\( T \\) defined by \\( T[z] = \\int_{0}^{t} e^{-st} z(u) du \) is studied, where \\( s \\) is a constant complex number.

If the initial complex function \\( z(0) = z_0 \\) and allowed to evolve under its transformation for a time period T without further intervention, will \\( T[z(T)] \\) be independent of the matrix \\( A \\)?
Explanation: The evolution of \\( z(t) \\) under the matrix \\( A \\) affects its trajectory, thus altering the outcome of the integral transformation \\( T[z(T)] \\. Since \\( T[z] \\) includes an integration dependent on the path of \\( z(t) \\) from 0 to T (influenced by \\( A \\)), it is not independent of \\( A \\).
